New Records: The Texas Rangers set a record with an 11-0 postseason road win streak.
Corey Seager hit two home runs in the World Series.
Marcus Semien hit his first World Series home run in the clinching game.
Key Match Events: 5-0 win in Game 5 of the World Series.
Marcus Semien hit a two-run home run in the ninth inning.
Zac Gallen pitched a no-hitter for six innings before losing it with a single by Corey Seager.
Pre-Game Insights: The Rangers' success was built on trust in key signings and leadership.
Manager Bruce Bochy's old-school approach and adaptability were crucial.
Post-Match Reflections: The victory ended a 62-year World Series drought for the Texas Rangers.
Players and manager expressed emotional reactions to the win.
The team's resilience and leadership were highlighted by Marcus Semien and Bruce Bochy.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers were the lowest seed to win the World Series.
The team's performance improved after a mid-season funk.
The victory marked a turning point in their franchise history.
